Pre-Game Insights: India will be eagerly pursuing the twin goals of a series sweep and monitoring the progress of impressive second-line players during the third and final T20 against Bangladesh on Saturday, October 12, 2024.
India have already bagged the series 2-0 after wins at Gwalior and New Delhi.
A 3-0 sweep will sit nicely along with the 2-0 margin in the preceding Test series.
Gautam Gambhir and his colleagues in the backroom have set in motion the process of finding able support cast to frontline players keeping in mind the long-term goals such as the ICC event next year.
Mayank Yadav bowled at over 150 clicks while Chakravarthy returned with a three-wicket haul in his first outing in blue in three years at Gwalior.
Nitish Kumar Reddy, highly impressive in the Delhi T20 while smashing a 34-ball 74 and returning with a couple of wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The failure of openers has put a bit of strain on the middle-order, as the hosts were 41 for three inside the power play segment before the middle-order bailed them out in the second T20I.
For Bangladesh, the visitors will strive to taste that elusive victory on this tour.
The visitors will need a consistent effort, particularly from seniors like captain Najmul Hossain Shanto, Litton Das and Mustafizur Rahman who all have been disappointing till now.
Others: Sanju Samson has given a chance to open the innings in this series and itâ€™s a godsend in T20s, giving the batter a chance to exploit the six power play overs.
The backroom staff would want a substantial outing from Abhishek who too has produced lukewarm 15 and 16 in the last two matches.
The team think-tank will decide whether to hand a match to some other worthy names on the bench like leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi and all-rounder Harshit Rana.
